qas.question: Along with reducing the federal deficit, what was Eisenhower's main policy priority as president?

answers.text: keep pressure on the Soviet Union

qas.question: What did Eisenhower threaten to use to end the Korean War?
Along with Guatemala, what country's government did Eisenhower order overthrown?
What country did Eisenhower neglect to assist in their military action in Vietnam?
In what year was the Formosa Resolution passed?

context: Eisenhower's main goals in office were to <a0_0>keep pressure on the Soviet Union<a0_0/> and reduce federal deficits. In the first year of his presidency, he threatened the use of <a1_0>nuclear weapons<a1_0/> in an effort to conclude the Korean War; his New Look policy of nuclear deterrence prioritized inexpensive nuclear weapons while reducing funding for conventional military forces. He ordered coups in <a2_0>Iran<a2_0/> and Guatemala. Eisenhower refused to give major aid to help <a3_0>France<a3_0/> in Vietnam. He gave strong financial support to the new nation of South Vietnam. Congress agreed to his request in <a4_0>1955<a4_0/> for the Formosa Resolution, which obliged the U.S. to militarily support the pro-Western Republic of China in Taiwan and continue the isolation of the People's Republic of China.
